channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New CEOs and positive earnings have these stocks moving
item.description: Good day, 360! Here are our top investing ideas today. And TODAY, Jason is opening up the Roadmap Room for live trading with him today at 12EST. Bring your lunch ü•™ and your market optimism! FOCUS LISTüîé VIRX ‚Äì Up over 20% in the pre-market after reporting Q2 financial results and positive Phase 2 data [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Most American retirees wouldn‚Äôt be able to replace Social Security on their own
item.description: On its 89th birthday, Social Security remains Americans‚Äô primary source for retirement income.

item.title: White House says negotiated prices for Medicare drugs will save U.S. $6 billion, beneficiaries $1.5 billion in first year
item.description: It is a milestone in a controversial process that aims to make costly medications more affordable for older Americans but is strongly opposed by drugmakers.

item.title: Alibaba shares dip 3% after quarterly earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: Deere‚Äôs stock pops premarket after earnings sweep past lowered estimates
item.description: Deere & Co.‚Äôs stock rose 4% early Thursday, after the agricultural and construction machinery maker swept past lowered earnings estimates for its fiscal third quarter.

item.title: Inside the $93 million Wall Street heist that stemmed from Russia
item.description: CNBC podcast "The Crimes of Putin's Trader" recounts the rise and fall of Vladislav Klyushin and his business empire. He was just released from a U.S. prison in a prisoner swap.

item.title: Adyen tops profit forecast on market expansion and slower hiring, shares jump

item.title: Three different factors could trigger the third wave of a stock market pullback, says strategist
item.description: Dhaval Joshi, chief strategist of BCA Research‚Äôs Counterpoint service, says an analysis of the ‚Äúprice complexity‚Äù shows that the yen carry trade and the AI bubble are one and the same trade, and that any of three factors could torpedo it.

item.title: Columbia University president resigns months after Israel-Hamas war protests roiled campus
item.description: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik said she resigned on Wednesday, nearly four months after overseeing the university's handling of campus protests over Israel's war in Gaza.

item.title: Ukraine must decide how its Russian incursion ends ‚Äî advance further or retreat before it's too late
item.description: Ukraine must decide whether to try to hold or advance its incursion, or to withdraw now before Russia mounts what could be a furious and deadly response.

item.title: Great earnings have these stocks firing
item.description: *sponsored by The Market Master‚Äôs Trading Room is open today but will be a little quiet, as we mourn the loss of JW‚Äôs stock market faithful companion, Bentley. Although Bentley could not ‚Äúlegally‚Äù tell someone to buy or sell a stock, a bark or two from him when JW was digging in it gave you [‚Ä¶]

item.title: I have my RMD all figured out, except for one thing: Which investments should I take it from?
item.description: If you don‚Äôt specify exactly what you want to do, your bank may pull your required minimum distribution equally from all your holdings.

item.title: Starbucks is giving incoming CEO Brian Niccol $85 million in cash and stock as he departs Chipotle
item.description: Starbucks plans to pay incoming CEO Brian Niccol $10 million in cash and $75 million in equity awards when he joins the company from Chipotle.

item.title: Wizz Air launches $550 'all you can fly' annual subscription pass
item.description: Travelers in Europe can now take unlimited flights for 499 euros ($550) a year under a new travel subscription service from budget carrier Wizz Air.

item.title: Major players are buying puts. Why?
item.description: *sponsored by We haven‚Äôt seen this since the-pandemic-that-shall-not-be-named. My trading partner Taiku pointed something out to me Tuesday that really opened my eyes to what‚Äôs going on in the markets. Yeah, we had a big sell-off earlier this week and the VIX spiked. But that‚Äôs not the real story‚Ä¶ the VIX gradually went back down [‚Ä¶]

item.title: 6 ways to build a successful retirement
item.description: What people in their 50s, 60s and 70s should know about navigating life after work

item.title: Trump packs economic speech with personal attacks on Harris
item.description: The speech came as the Trump campaign retools its message after President Joe Biden withdrew his reelection bid and endorsed Harris as his replacement.

item.title: European markets higher as investors digest UK growth, cooler-than-expected U.S. inflation
item.description: European stocks opened higher Thursday as investors digest cooler-than-expected inflation readings in the U.S and U.K.
